channel.title: DGP on Zhenhao's projects
channel.description: Recent content in DGP on Zhenhao's projects

item.title: Generate weak factors
item.description: Before introducing the methods to estimate the number of strong and weak factors for high dimensional data, let me first introduce how to genernate the weak factors in the DGP and corresponding R codes. Consider the factor model as: $$ Y = X + \Sigma^{\frac{1}{2}}E = \Sigma^{\frac{1}{2}} (\sqrt{T} \hat{U} \hat{D} \hat{V}’ + E), $$ where $\sqrt{T} \hat{U} \hat{D} \hat{V}^{'}$ is the singular value decomposition (SVD) for $\Sigma^{-\frac{1}{2}}X$ with $\hat{U} \in \mathbb{R}^{N\times \min (N,T)}$, $\hat{V} \in \mathbb{R}^{T \times \min (N,T)}$, $\hat{D}= \text{diag} (\hat{d}_{1}, \hat{d}_{2}, \cdots, \hat{d}_{\min (N, T)})$, $\hat{U}' \hat{U} = \hat{V}' \hat{V} = I_{\min (N, T)}$, and $\hat{d}_{1} \geq \hat{d}_{2} \geq , \cdots, \geq \hat{d}_{\min (N, T)}$.
